author: @LukeofSmeg
text:
First it was zombies, then it was comics now it's video games, can Holly just stop and do something original that isn't trite psuedo-highbrow BS. Like I wouldn't mind but there's not exactly a lack of ideas given everything going on in the world right now. Instead of obsessive marketing trying to make films that on paper they think everyone would love, they should stick to making films the people making said films love. Marvels films expanded on an existing franchise, if producers went out on a limb and took a risk, they wouldn't need to rely on other franchises, they could make their own, but they are too greedy.

They treat investing in ordinary business as charity so I don't even want to know how they view the arts! Really stupid and short sighted of them to be honest, but then again I guess in 2024 when there are easier, completely unregulated ways of making money that requires less risk and less management, of course they are going to be selfish and take that option. It's exactly why government needs to step in, because they will continue to make horrible investments unless prevented from doing so. Investors couldn't give a toss about creating jobs or art or even products for people. If they could they'd rather all sit in Singapore ripping each other off on their speculative assets, leaving everything else to rot.

text:
Thank god this movie flopped! But then I was disappointed, for once I love the actual critics on Rotten Tomatoes‚Ä¶ They gave this 10% and the audience gave it 53%‚Ä¶ How pathetic. üòÇ



For starters, Kevin Hart‚Äôs role should have been given to the likes of Terry Crews or Idris Elba, hell even Michael B Jordan would have been better. Cate Blanchettes character is not only supposed to be like a badass waifu (which this is not), but she‚Äôs also not supposed to be played by a Woman in her 60‚Äôs‚Ä¶ Then instead of Mordecai or Brick, they add in Krieg and Tiny Tina as the other 2 in the main cast‚Ä¶ If all of that‚Äôs not pathetic enough, look at the side characters they went and got decent sized actors for in Jack Black, Bobby Lee and Jamie Lee Curtis‚Ä¶ All of that and it flopped, and do ya‚Äôll know why? Because it didn‚Äôt stick to the source material. Just like that deadbeat playing Snow White, if you have an issue with the original story because ‚Äúit‚Äôs from a long time ago and it‚Äôs problematic‚Äù, then you shouldn‚Äôt appear in them. You can‚Äôt talk down on an ALREADY MADE story, perform in a new pile of garbage that keeps the original name but with a completely different story and then when it fails you say ‚Äú??? are evil!‚Äù. The new Snow White will flop, just like almost every other Live Action (which should have been all, but there are delusional morons who exist). üòÇ

Were to start I just watched the borderlands movie the cast was recruited from the local nursing home blanchete and Curtis one of the worst things in the movie tiny tina wasn't insane she was sane very boring everything was wrong with her backstory nothing like the games and one of my favourite characters from the games flushed down the toilet Bite size Roland was awful it's Kevin hart playing himself as in every other movie he's in nothing related to the games would off been better casting Terry Crews would be more authentic. I didn't mind Jack Black as claptrap It's disgraceful to call this dull mess a borderlands movie the setting of it felt more like a very cheap B movie it's like the director and writers had never played the games just looked at the back cover of the game box and said that's good enough. Aside from the cast and everything else this movie wasn't made for fans of the games it was made for absolutely knowone would of thought RANDY PITCHFORD wouldn't have sold out and he'd had some sort of creative input and would of actually made a borderlands movie for fans based on the games and not make one of the worst video game movies ever made disgraceful I would recommend that fans of the games don't watch this train wreck of geriatric dull sanity.

Why was none of the original vault hunters in the movie they could of used Brick and Mordecai this would of added some depth it's just over an hour and 40 minutes I'll never get back I'm a fan of the borderlands games well except the woke mess of borderlands 3 my opinion of borderlands has gone down quite a bit I guess I'll have to wait for borderlands 4 to see if the franchise can be redeemed?

author: @Hammern28
text:
Just saw this movie and... I... guess it was kinda almost arrite.
But... not really. It had every chance of being something cool, like the games, but... it is all a bit cliche filled with poorly coordinated action sequences, music that feels out of place and characters that are hard to like. Well, the robot was the cool one.

I mean, the production set, special effects and everything, is very good. But that is just about all. It is also trying to be funny, but it ain't. Like the music in this trailer, it feels like it is trying to be as cool as Guardians Of The Galaxy or something, but fails miserably.

I have spoken.

author: @christopherseet3993
text:
Not so badass after all...

Casting director with a huge "L" here... The movie will probably make a bit at the box office and Lionsgate will think they did a good job, but really, they should have got actors who have actually played the games and relate to the characters than try to assemble a star studded cast of actors who are typically typecasted already. They are good actors - don't get me wrong, but their range just isn't there.

They also forget that many of the people going to watch these films have put in HUNDREDS or even THOUSANDS of HOURSs into the base material, so to suddenly have someone that doesn't or can't pull off the character is really really jarring - even for something you're only going to be watching for an hour or so.

So yeah, the director and the casting director are huge Ls. To put borrow a line from Borderlands: "Bring (them) a bucket and they'll show you ... that they don't know what a bucket is!"

I'd advise avoiding any of their future projects on the back of this because you know what kind of quality you're going to get from these psychos. Someobody ought to kick them so hard in the balls that they explode!

author: @dragonfruitbobagirly
text:
This movie was marketed so lazily. One trailer 5 months before release? On what planet did they think it was going to go well üòπ

You‚Äôre supposed to release a teaser a year before release, trailer 2 six months before release, trailer 3 three months before release. This isn‚Äôt a video game like Halo or COD, it‚Äôs a video game with a CULT FOLLOWING.

So to absolutely market this like Jumanji with mainstream actors and internet personalities, was far too cocky and lazy. They thought ‚Äúlet‚Äôs give gamers a movie they want and let‚Äôs carbon copy Jumanji!‚Äù

I‚Äôm so sick of seeing Kevin Hart in every single movie like this, can we miss him a little please? Sheesh.

Cate should have been Moxxi. Lilith is not an older woman she‚Äôs 20‚Äôs-30‚Äôs solid.

And Bobby Lee? Really? Just because his Internet personality is doing well doesn‚Äôt mean we want to see him in this movie.

I blame the producers for rushing this project. You shouldn‚Äôt rush a project when it‚Äôs a cult game with a cult fan base. Pure idiocy. This is why they need to sit down with real gamers who played the first Borderlands and 2/3. They thought they were making easy money and thanks to that flying too close to the sun mentality we now have a flop that could have been amazing. They should have had a mix of a younger and seasoned cast.

Jamie Lee as the Doctor? Are you fkn kidding me? The Doctor looks more like Rachel Weisz if anything. BIG missed opportunity there acting as if the Doctor is a 60-70 year old woman. üíÄ

author: @Tiresias55
text:
Did anyone actually bother to watch the movie before commenting? Genuine question.
Granted, I never played the game, (I'm blind so can't, if anyone wants to ask me how I typed this, go ahead and reply, I'll reply to your questions).

Truth time, I tend to be a very optamistic person with a pretty sunny outlook, and I get that isn't a popular way to be in 2024, but I've been on this road so long and I'd rather have that than hop onto a different path. But I've always tried to give a movie a chance, where I could, basing my judgements on the material's own merrets. I know this isn't ever going to get me a job reviewing movies, but still. Having watched the movie once, I can honestly say I loved it. The humour was pretty on point though could've been dialled back a bit, and the characters were fun and entertaining. Can't comment on the CGI etc, because read above, am blind, but the sound affects, musical scores, and acting didn't make me pick up my pop corn and walk out, so it gets a solid 6 out of 10 for me, probably 6 approaching 7 because yes, I am that nice a person.

And this is how much I liked it, I will watch it again the next chance I get.

TLDR- Never gonna get a job as a nice guy movie reviewer.

I love all of these actors. Still it's the absolute worst cast imaginable for a BL movie. Cate is great, but way too old. Kevin Hart as Roland? Roland is one of the most serious characters in BL and they choose to let the small funny dude portray him? Jack Black? JB could have so many great fitting roles in BL, fuck I would've even taken him as a male version of Ellie. Moxxi is too old aswell. At least give them proper Borderlands-ish make-up. Or just animate the thing altogether.

Edit.: I wonder if there's a single person who worked on this movie that actually has played BL. I strongly doubt it.

author: @sdsd-ne9hg
text:
Wait, this is a real movie?!
I don't stay on top of movies anymore so i had herd nothing about this being made, so i see the trailer thinking it's some fan made A.I. generated stuff or something, like Dora the explorer with the rock kind of stuff, and i was impressed because it sort of looked like a real trailer from a movie but made to be silly, like a joke in the style of "here is what hollywood would do with this IP if they make a movie from it". But wow how things change when you find out it's a real trailer, it went from a rather funny and interesting fan made project to the cringiest movie trailer i have seen in the passed decade.
The casting was funny as a "here is what hollywood would do", but that was just me projecting actual intelligent decision making onto the absurdity that is hollywood stupidity.

author: @phousefilms
text:
Heard how shitty this was already and how the director is Feig'ing it(I call it that, where the director blames the audience for the movie being crap, like Paul Feig's "Ghostbusters". Feig'ing also works for "MIB:International"and Elizabeth Banks "Charlie's Angel's").
Watching this trailer, it gets the characters so wrong. Roland is supposed to be the straight man, Lillith is a grandma(and Cate Blanchett's face may be frozen with botox, but she can't pull off playing a young woman)but video game Tiny Tina would not be screaming at 1:06, she would be demanding to go through again. Shows I know the character better than the director.

author: @MichaelPohoreski
text:
=== Miscast Mistakes were Made ===
* (Straight man) Roland miscast as (unfunny) Kevin Hart,
* (Young) Lilith miscast as (grandma) Cate Blanchett,
* Tiny Tina miscast as (discount Harley Quinn) Ariana Greenblatt instead of Ashly Burch is unforgivable,
* Clap Trap miscast as Jack Black (and not Jim Foronda the original voice of Clap Trap is insanity.)

What the hell was the casting director smoking??

author: @Jayremy89
text:
Cate is old, her voice is worn & raspy. Just from the get go she didn't appeal in any sense, that wig idea is trash.

I've seen MANY borderlands cosplayers that actually do the cel shading great & way better than the stupid art choice for this movie.

If they actually bothered to get decent artists & artistry, did less digital & green screen & more old school shots with cel-shading, they'd nail the visual aesthetic with something new & unique.

Kevin Hart llaying himself...

ClapTrap was fine, but the humor was very drawn out & forced.

The idea for the plot was weak. It deserves more time to explore the nuance of the sci fi world & environment, develop the characters to the audience, the characters need to look like they are actually struggling & have a real serious task on their hands. The could have made a show of it, not a movie & went through quests & adventures of the world.

Jamie Lee Curtis looked extremely out of place & goofy, and that considering Lilith & Roland bad casting, being worse.

Then this is like a very lame Gaurdians of the Galaxy style rip off with a lame pg-13 audience goal.

Too much pointless "comedy" yapping in mid action & suspense sequences. The did so many lame "pause for one liners" scenes.

Goddamn, poor actors. Love all those people I ain't holding it against them at all. They became the janitors of Hollywood and had to try to clean up and present a shitty script to the world.

So here's what we actually need. Whoever did the costumes, set pieces, hair, makeup, ok lets be honest, ANYONE THAT WASNT THE DIRECTOR/WRITER, they all did great, but directors/actors/writers get them out, get the current actors out, ALL of them coz whoever did casting is obviously some hollywood schlog's kid being 'handed opportunities'. Yeah, those actors are all talented. No, they aren't the talent you need. Like using a paperclip to change a tire. That's not what it's for. The fact the casting crew/director doesn't know how to utilize the tools they have or bring the right tools to the job are on THEM, not the actors. I just got back from a late night showing and this was one of the worst pieces of shit movies I've seen.   I honestly just wanted to walk out, but after paying good money for the goddamn ticket,  I made myself stick it thru.    It was awful.   The casting sucked for starters.  You have a 50+ year old granny playing Lilith,  a character meant to be about 20 years younger.   Kevin Hart doesn't fit his character at all either,   he would have better as ClapTrap.   Speaking of Claptrap,  Jack Black is fine as a voice actor,  but the character just got annoying after being funny at first.   Piece of shit movie.  0/10 .   Not even a 1.

text: I know nothing about borderlands, and I watched the movie with zero expectations. My issue with it is the overacting. I love fantasy movies, and characters in these movies used to be believable in their own world. Characters in fantasy movies nowadays feel like very fictional characters that try to belong to their fictional worlds, which is such a shame. The most impressive thing is casting Cate Blanchett as a badass main character. A lot of people hate it, but I find it very inspiring. All I thought was "wow, I want to be a cool 55 year old badass who looks amazing in video games cosplay" üòÇ

author: @TheEphemeralEternity
text:
Ok so...this looks like the epitome of the budget trying to carry the movie way too hard.

Lots of wasted potential. Kevin as Roland and Jack as Claptrap I can kind of see at least, but you couldn't have picked a younger actress as Lilith? I adore Cate Blanchett, but Lilith is not a classy lady. She is a quippy, crass bounty hunter that has more power than she knows what to do with. I feel like Emma Stone would have been an easy fit here.

And where the heck are Brick and Mordecai? All you had to do to make the movie rock solid was type cast the main characters and let them have a field day on set. I am happy they tossed in Krieg at least, but I can't imagine a complete lunatic is going to be an easy role to sell for an entire movie..

As a huge fan of the video game, I‚Äôve always wanted a movie that matches that apocalyptic, solo survival mode, etc., but this is not it. I hope a director who understands the game's vibe and storyline picks up this story again someday and can deliver what the fans deserve. It's such a waste of such a good game storyline and potentially detrimental to the franchise. I am disappointed with what I have just watched.

author: @LordSeethe
text:
Borderlands has some of the most entertaining and creative lore-building in scifi, and yet instead of making their own story with the world they've been given, they choose to rehash the same characters, plot, and setting that have already had their curtain call, while retaining very little of what makes their personalities and traits consistent with what we know and love.

If you want a good idea of how to tell a great spinoff story in the Borderlands universe, "Tales From the Borderlands" was CLEARLY made by people who understood and loved the core franchise (well, at least the first half, the second half went a little off track tbh, but apparently it's because the company making it was allegedly getting shut down or bankrupt or something, so maybe they get a pass, but Hollywood is clearly not going bankrupt, so Hollywood does not get to use that excuse)

author: @phantompyro6482
text: People actually defendinf this trailer don't understand the point of movie adaptations. For the most part adaptations would bonb without fan backing, they may get some hype but it's unlikely. The fans of the franchise are what goad others into watching and trying the franchise, like with game-movie/show adaptations like FNaF and Fallout. They encourage new viewers to enjoy the series. This trailer is devoid of any of the charm of the original trilogy. The focus was on the goofy characters and the pooe casting and delivery of every line in this trailer shows me (and as the other comments show others) how little the producers knew about the Borderlands series. It knew how to be fun and lightheaded, but also how to take itself seriously when it came down to it. Also, Jack Black as Claptrap is nauseating, Claptrap is a derpy moron who's so deeply self absorbed that despite being a fairly physically weak (at least in B1 and B2) sees himself as a ruler. He bosses the player around because he's so enamored with himself and it's made funny and endearing because he has such a high pitched and whiny voice that shows how pathetic he actually is in comparison to his actions. Unless they make significant changes (which I doubt they will) they'll likely only receive hate watching views because other than the fanbase at its core this looks like a cheap version of Guardians of the Galaxy so those who aren't fans likely will take a pass on it

author: @shmixedNshmooved
text:
This is literally a movie for nobody.

It's a slap in the face if you're a die-hard fan of the older games. If you're a returning fan, this just confuses the timeline and plot even more while bastardizing beloved characters and turning them into caricatures, and I can't imagine a new viewer finding interest in the concept of "Borderlands but if it was just a slapstick comedy" if you've never found the game's interesting before. This movie literally has zero purpose and zero appeal other than for watching it crash and burn.

author: @TheTaintedWisdom
text:
You can tell the creators of this film really did their homework! I haven't seen such an accurate representation of how bad the source material is since hearing about the Halo show's reception! Pairing the terrible on-screen content with an actually good song that has no business being featured alongside such dog $#!+ is so "Borderlands" it's not even funny! Easily one of the most accurate translations of a game to film I've ever seen!

Frankly, I'm amazed it wasn't written or directed by anyone from Gearbox themselves! The Studio executives REALLY knew what they were doing when they approached Eli Roth for this project! Truely, well done!

...However, I will say, if I find out that anyone involved in this gets within a lightyear of touching the character's from Telltale's Tales From the Borderlands? AKA the literal only good thing to come out of this godforsaken franchise? I'm gonna need to know their... baggie preferences if you catch my drift...

author: @trippeddownthestairs8238
text: I loved the Borderlands franchise of games so I probably will see this movie at some point, but I don't really see much of a plot. Yes, the characters were vault hunters, so finding the vault should be important. However, the Borderlands games have fully developed characters and plots. This trailer looks like a generic action movie. Additionally, I am confused about the characters. Brick and Mordecai are essential characters to the franchise-- much more central than Tiny Tina or Kreig (even though those characters have a place too). And also, I don't know who the main villain is going to be, but I won't take this movie seriously if it is not Handsome Jack. The games spent so much time developing the character of Handsome Jack that it would be malpractice to exclude him in a movie adaptation.

author: @Direkin
text:
Interesting, but my very first question is why do they all look so old? Tiny Tina should be a teenager, and by that I mean 13 or so, Roland should be mid 30s and a beef cake, Lilith mid 20s, Tannis in her 30s. Granted by BL3, Tiny Tina is already an adult, but Roland would have died years ago (in BL2). The opening scene suggests that they're coming to Pandora for the first time, in which case they wouldn't have met Tiny Tina. However, the info box suggests that they're returning to Pandora, in which case they would already know about all the vaults (and Roland would be no more). And is that psycho supposed to be Krieg?

Ohh, that's the Vladof Infinity pistol in the opening scene.

author: @HiddenBlade
text:
The cast is fucked and this doesn't make sense. Roland, Lilith, DR Tannis are originally from the same game (borderlands 1 where Lilith is 27 and Roland is 34 and Tannis is in her 30s) yet here he looks younger than Lilith and Tannis, is short and slim and not 1.80 and bulky, Krieg shouldn't be here unless it's as a young kid, Zero and Mordecai are missing entirely, so is brick and the commando from the second game (sorry all forgot his name) overall this looks like ass, is entirely wrong and shows that whoever made this movie has fuck all respect for this franchise.

If you're gonna set it in the world fine if you're gonna tell an original story also fine, but If you mess it up so bad that unless you explain this away with them getting mixed up by a time warp and Roland coming from an alternate universe where everyone is short you might as well not do it.

It's not hard to set up a timeline do 15 minutes of googling and get these things right. Then tell an original story somewhere where they could realistically meet, we'd love it. But don't fuck with an established IP by mixing and matching things that make no sense at all.

The only one cast well is jack black.

author: @FluidRat
text:
I really like how they made an entire scene for a simple throwaway gag of "Creek where people piss maybe." They couldn't even cast the scene right, a gully is just a small ravine made by passing water, not a whole plains section with puddles of...HuUUUUgh...

I'm gonna be honest, I don't think this was meant to be a Borderlands movie, it screams "We were going to lose the movie rights so we need to crank something out ASAP for our bottom line" Everything seems off. There's not a single clue as to what the story is aside from "Vault Treasure." None of the casting works, it's going to spit on the timeline, and you can see the execs just saying "We want a Guardians of the Galaxy." I'm not normally one to shit on the opinions of others, but to anyone holding out hope or coping with "So long as it's funny, it doesn't matter," let me point out. If their casting is just to capture the widest viewer base possible without caring about accuracy, do you think they're going to have competent writers making jokes that aren't targeting the lowest common denominator?

author: @calls7378
text:
I'm late to the party here.

As a borderlands fan, I have to see this and I am sure I will hate every second while ditting in the theatre.

First of all, Eli Roth, why is he the director of this film? He's a cool dude, absolutely, but come on... the director of quite disturbing movies like Hostel, it doesn't fit the borderlands vibe. He should stick with disturbing movies rather than colorful shlooter video games. Maybe sit in the gaming chair instead on your freetime and make some sick gutwrenching movies instead.

The actors, doesnt fit at all. No one of them fit for their character. Once I saw that Hart is playing a part I instantly knew this movie will flop. He's better on the stage roasting himself rather than playing a main character.

As a filmmaker myself, I would love to make a borderlands movie, the right way. I have been growing up with it, and I'm sure I would easily make it better than this. (Sorry for boosting my ego here)

author: @timel_ss
text:
There are so many things wrong with this that it makes me wish they kept the original Sonic design for the Paramount movie.

Yes. I went there.

I have nothing against any of the cast, but the director and producer just basically made a movie long meme of "tell me you don't know x without telling me you don't know x".

Critical issues: why the fuck is Krieg there? Why is Tina get BL3 Form? Why is Lilith twice the age she was in the games (no offence to Cate, amazing actress but what the sh-t)? Why isn't Marcus narrating? Why didn't they go with the woman who literally ACTUALLY did Lilith in the games? Why Kevin Hart for this role? Why does it have a PG-13 rating now?

This is just the tip of the iceberg. Like.. canonically this makes absolutely zero sense from a Borderlands POV and Borderlands is all over the place. I'm sorry but NGL, this movie won't be worth it until it comes to streaming and even then I probably won't watch it. üòÇ

author: @SmiercYT
text: I don't want to just say something negative like everyone tends to do about every new media that comes out. Make a new game everyone complains, make a movie everyone cries. I think the movie looks good, and I think if the company got less backlash about the third game that game would have had the chance to grow into what borderlands 2 was and got more content. I actually think Kevin Hart is a decent pick for Roland, my thing is the rest of the cast clearly doesnt know their characters personality. This is extremely jarring if you played the games, even the script doesnt sound like a Tina line or Lilith line. But I have hope that this company will try to replicate the traction from the second game, I still play borderlands every day. I really hope they don't get discouraged and give a good effort for the new borderlands media to come. Like I said these are valid points I'm trying to point out, not complain or jump on some hate wagon; looking forward to seeing this hope it turns out nice.

author: @fredzep01
text:
Just on sight it works fantastic, but since being a fan of borderlands since day one,
and spending more time playing it than any other game I've played, this will annoy the shit out of me !
Why do they insist on using stars in this, there's no need for them, there shouldn't be any specific need for character depth,
stars in movies like this also distract the viewer from the amazing world they lovingly created, I won't be able to stay invested when Kevin Hart opens his mouth and I get distracted and puled from the BL universe because of his squeaky annoying voice,
or when my mind will inevitably wonder off to think about a particular trading places scene when ever JLC shows her face....

This could have been incredibly better, if only they had used their heads and used actors deserved of the roles instead of the
selecting actors who's just flavor of the month.....

author: @alexlyon7420
text: I have put some hate about this flic out into the world since hearing it was coming.  Sadly...from the trailers I have seen it seems warranted!  I was hoping I was just feeling a certain way over poor casting choices and Roland being reincarnated (as comic relief mind you, given he was the calm and rational one) but they have completely missed the mark.  The trailers all seem lifeless and grasping for laughs/excitement for dear life while being absolutely lack luster.  Even if this was nothing more than a stand alone, it doesn't fit anywhere in the timeline and can't fit into the actual canon, which I think is great given it lacks the charm and charisma ( and story telling and humor, etc.) of the games.  So now let's assume it is a stand alone reimagining and hold it to that standard...from what I have seen the humor being used died off 7 years back and is no longer relevant ( or funny) and the cast is full of many great talents...that feel like they are phoning it in for a pay check and don't care at all about the content.  I love this group of talent, but what I am seeing is really making me question the validity of that, though I have never really gotten a positive  feel for cate blanchet in any of her roles, and furthering this with borderlands seems on point.  But when did borderlands enter the realm of equilibrium with gun katas'? This just adds to the lack of borderlands vibes and the overall confusion.

author: @Irish_Saiyan92
text:
This trailer is 3 months old, and... I hadn't seen it until now. I'm not a HUGE Borderlands fan but I enjoy playing it. Although I haven't finished 2 yet. Watching this trailer kinda made me feel a little sad.

Why is it that there have been positive steps forward with adaptations like Sonic, Mario, Last of Us and Fallout, only to fall backwards? Doesn't make any sense. At all. All I can hope for is, that I'm wrong, it's a blast and fans enjoy it. But something tells me that's probably/possibly not gonna happen.

I'm calling it right now, I'm sure others have called it too so I'm just adding my call to the pile: Handsome Jack is gonna be teased in the ending, or appear briefly in the mid or after credits scene. Oh and maybe an appearance from Buttstallion.

author: @coolwing449
text:
Ok, mis casting aside, and I agree with most of that‚Ä¶ when I found out Kevin Hart was playing Roland, that felt really off until I saw the trailer, and then it was a huge wtf moment. Correct me if I‚Äôm wrong, isn‚Äôt Roland the strong, deep voice, calm, calculating type‚Ä¶ at least it‚Äôs how I remember him form BL2. So who the‚Ä¶ is this character played by Hart? Not only does Kevin not fit the bill for my mind as Roland, the ‚ÄúRoland‚Äù in this movie seems to be some neurotic dufus. I get the casting goof, but did the writers even play a single Borderlands game???

Funny that a director friend mentioned Hart and Black were both in Jumanji. IMO, if they had just stared with the Jumanji cast, they‚Äôd have been a lot better from the get go. Johnson as Roland, Anderson as Lilith, Black as Claptrap and Hart as‚Ä¶ idk‚Ä¶ Tiny Tina.

Fallout did it right!!! It seems most people who love the game, love the series. And‚Ä¶ most importantly‚Ä¶ a lot of people who know nothing about the game also love the series‚Ä¶ because it was well done and has a great story.

I feel the producers of Borderlands are hoping to cash in mainly from those who don‚Äôt know the game. In fact, I feel mostly those who would see casting mismatches are those who know the game. However, alienate the core base of players, lose the hype, have a meh response‚Ä¶ and‚Ä¶ may be yet another video game to movie flop. Assassins Creed anyone ???

For myself, love the games. Have played most. Wonderlands was maybe my favorite, but I digress. For myself, I was excited‚Ä¶ then I saw the trailer‚Ä¶ after which I had a little vomit in my mouth. I have zero desire to pay full price and see this on the big screen. Probably worth a $2 rental a few months after release. Maybe go see it at the theatre on $5 Tuesday‚Ä¶ maybe. But if enough bad reviews come out‚Ä¶ it may just be a pass. Why watch something you love get crapped all over? Do I hope the masses love it? If it makes BL4 even better‚Ä¶ sure.

author: @ToxicallyMasculinelol
text:
They should have just made it an animated movie. What is it with the obsession with making everything live action? Borderlands works precisely because of its surreal, comically ridiculous style. It's not supposed to be like real life. Seeing real life people dressed up as bandits and psychos just makes me cringe. This is not a story that could happen in the real world. The casting for all the main characters is ridiculous too, but this whole thing is just fundamentally misconceived even before anyone hit the casting couch. It's actually a bad idea at rock bottom to make a live action Borderlands film. It should have been an animated film using the actual art style from Borderlands. Just a movie story similar to the cutscenes of the games, but with a higher budget and better writing. That's all they needed to do and it would have sold like crack. If it actually honored the universe (and particularly the style and humor of the most beloved game, Borderlands 2), players would eat it up. But instead it comes across like some studio executive who's never played Borderlands was flipping through a catalog of popular franchises they own or could cheaply license, and settled on Borderlands as a potential way to make a quick buck by capitalizing on the tired trend of live action remakes.

And it isn't even a sound financial decision, because these live action remakes are not the safe bets Hollywood execs seem to think they are. Because it worked for Disney a handful of times, they think a safe way to make money now is by turning any beloved franchise into a live action movie. But most of the attempts have been colossal flops. Only Disney was able to pull it off at the box office, and that has more to do with the huge recognition factor of the properties they succeeded with. When they tried it with less notable properties, it failed for them too. And Borderlands is not nearly as well known among normies (the "moviegoing public") as The Lion King lol. So even if it was Disney producing it, this still would not have worked. But it's particularly for Borderlands because the whole concept of the Borderlands universe simply does not work in live action, and they would have known that if they had even played 10 minutes of the game or even just watched some cutscenes on YouTube. It's painfully obvious. But that's how you know this is a soulless cash grab: only a complete and utter shill, without even a passing familiarity with the games, looking for a quick buck off a live action remake, could have thought Borderlands of all things would be a good choice for live action.

And it really cuts to the heart of the creative bankruptcy of Hollywood, doesn't it? They are so terrified of risk, so frothing at the mouth for a safe dollar, that they would rather make a live action remake of Borderlands than fund the development of a new idea. If I might be so bold, I'd argue this speaks to a general sickness in our culture, what some have termed "safetyism." Usually it's in reference to a fixation on physical safety at the expense of everything else, but I think it extends to an extreme aversion to risk in general, a fear of any kind of noxious stimulus, including (perhaps especially) monetary loss. People never wanted to lose money, but they used to be willing to take a risk, if not for the love of art, then even just for the promise of greater reward. Now they'd rather make maybe $15 million on a huge budget cash grab than make billions on the next Star Wars ‚Äì and I don't mean the next ripoff of Star Wars (see Rebel Moon), simply aping the aesthetics and concept, rather than doing what actually made Star Wars successful: something actually original, something you couldn't see anywhere else (at the time), yet simultaneously something that channeled timeless human universals like the monomyth, the hero's journey, the worship of a higher power, love, family, redemption, etc.

There's an unlimited, truly infinite number of stories that could do the same thing Star Wars did, and Hollywood could easily pull one of them off if they just took a goddamn risk on something new, but they're too afraid of failure, too caught up in the promise of safe profit, that they'd rather spend another $300 million not on doing what Star Wars did, but on aping how Star Wars looked on the surface. Frankly, it's depressing. I don't think this rut is permanent, but I don't suppose we'll see relief for many years. Perhaps a new generation will need to come along that can actually pick apart the defects in our overall culture, because this phobia did not arise in a vacuum, it splattered out of the bowels of mainstream, modern, western culture. To quote a truly great story: if we're looking for someone to blame, we need only look in the mirror.

author: @rek_extinct5298
text:
This is literally wrong in every single aspect.

1. The cast, as always, is whrog except Krieg, he just needs to be jacked.

2. Tina has the aspect of the 3rd game, BUT Roland is already dead on BL2, and Lilith dies at the end of the 3rd. (0 cronological sense)

3. Tanis has 60 and Lilith has 50, just why?

4. It seems like Hymperios has already collapsed, but that happens in the second game.

5. WHY isn't Jack the main villain? He is one of the best villains of all time. (Not the best)

6. Atlas isn't relevant until the third game (Red Guys). Why are they on Pandora?

7. Who tf is the main villain who controls the psichopats? He does not have the looks of Pandora or the villanous aspect of Borderlands.

8. Why is Roland making silly jokes in the middle of the combat? He is an ex-soldier, and even if he makes jokes, they make sense to the character's personality.

9. Which vault are they looking for? The one that probably got destroyed with the opening of Pandora in the third game?

author: @orikx4658
text: I have so many problems with the film I don't know where to start. The casting is completely wrong. Lilith and Tannis are too old. At 54, Cate Blanchett is a good 20 years too old and Jamie Lee Curtis just shoots the bird. The woman is 65 years old, twice as old as Tannis in the comics and films! In the games and comics they are both in their 30s. At the time of Part 2, Lilith is 32 and Tannis is only a few years older. Maybe 2-3 years older. In the comics, Lillith sees Tannis as something of an older sister. Roland is too small and too funny. Roland has always been the dutiful, slightly brittle type. A bit like the teacher's favorite who keeps things tidy during breaks. He rarely cracked jokes and his interactions with others were always rather professional, with the exception of a few people Tina, Lilith, etc. In the comics, he was so stubborn and brittle that both LIlith and Maya broke up with him because of it. How to choose the class clown for this role. That does not fit. And yes, Kevin is just too small, even if I could ignore that. And there's so much more you could say about Tina. Tina is very crazy in both the games and the comics. Not just a little crazy, but ready for the slap Crazy. For example, the child has dissociative personality disorder, a little bit of ADHD and gigantic teaumata. In the comics she is so crazy that when she was 12 she was able to live among bandits for almost a year because everyone thought she was a female psycho. I think the film Tina is a little too... Healthy? And my biggest problem with Borderlands is. When does the film take place? We see war, after or at the end of the second part. In the trailer we see Mouthpiece and the costumes and the design is more based on the 3rd. The chamber that is to be opened is the one on Pandora from the first part, just like the chamber monster. The film cannot be arranged chronologically. It's like they just took a bunch of story elements from all the parts and made it into a film. The film will probably be good and funny for everyone who doesn't know Borderlands. For everyone who knows and loves Borderlands, the film will be a slap in the face. I'm 100% sure about that.
